title: I feel like Riot doesn't even play their own champions.
body:
Lately I feel like champions are balanced without having enough knowledge about their gameplay.
I'm talking about this:
{{champion:85}} 
> On a separate note, we cleaned up a few** weird numbers **in Kennen’s other abilities_

probably talking about:

> MARK DURATION 6.25 seconds ⇒ 6 seconds
> 


WEIRD NUMBERS? There was a reason for that. At max rank, kennen was able to "chain" his W's thanks to that 0.25s, because his W has 6s CD at max rank. His passive used to last 8s, so he had a bigger window, but riot decided to nerf it without completely removing this chaining mechanic by giving him 0.25 extra seconds.

A lot of kennen players max W in the top lane, since it greatly improves your harass, wave clear and AOE damage.

In the same patch, they made some random changes to Viktor. Changes that make him feel clunkier, too.

Edit: for some reason people didn't get the point, I get that this patch was a buff overall, what i'm trying to say is that riot (or maybe just the guy who wrote the patch notes) doesn't really know their own Champions.
Also, did everyone forget about AD kennen?

[](http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/7/75/Kennen_OriginalLoading.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/110?cb=20160408234731)

replies.body:
The thing is;
Viktor, Kennen, Swain, Morde, Skarner, etc. have very small player bases and Riot doesn't have a lot of data on them, not to mention the apparent lack of mains of those champs in Riot's dev team.

They're underplayed and Riot has no real idea what they're even supposed to do and what reasons there are for players to actually enjoy playing these characters.
Sadly they're out of touch with these champs and do what THEY think is right and the appropriate course of action.
They may want to consider talking to those people who ACTUALLY play these champs and get some input why they like these characters and what the appeal of maining them is.

The issue is that they did talk w/ people who play these champs after the changes were announced. They just largely ignored the feedback.

There were like 4 Viktor threads on here with 100--400 upvotes each, and another on the main lol subreddit that was at the top of the page for a bit. What did they change? Practically nothing.

Not to mention:
"We feel like we screwed up with Shen, but we're not going to do anything about it. Sucks to be you."

:/
Yes, but take into account that people can grow fond of unhealthy aspects of a champion, so "keep what the mains like" is not a 100% applicable strategy.

Finding a middle ground and working on ways to keep the "feel" of the champion intact should take precedence over trying to preserve unhealthy aspects anyways.

Hell, I'm the first to admit that Morde's Iron Man's quite a hassle to deal with and could even give four possible solutions to the issue XP
I'm curious. What are these four solutions?

1. Add Jarvis.

The rest don't matter

/s

I get the feeling you are starting to give up on Riot. Your original Morde reworks posts were very polite and focused on building a rapport between the community and Riot. Now I am sensing a lot of defeat and helplessness in your posts. Not that I can say I blame you, Riot doesn't seem to be communicating or showing willingness to change tactics these days.

I actually did note this exact thing while playtesting this change. The argument I made, however, was that there was so much ambient CDR on so many items Kennen wants to build, it would likely be ok to allow it to happen. Even if you go Rylai's first item, you're going to end up getting a Zhyona's/Abyssal at some point and potentially even CDR boots if you want the summoner spell cooldown reduction for flash. I found myself very, very rarely unable to use the second cast of W after using it the first time.
That leaves me concerned when CDR isn't something you particularly itemize for, anymore, because it is on everything.
I would rather it be on more things than less. A lot of people complained about CDR not being easily reachable for many mages, and riot fixed that.
but now i feel like i'll find myself cdr capped and wasting gold on items that have it because i need the various passives/actives

>but now i feel like i'll find myself cdr capped and wasting gold on items that have it because i need the various passives/actives 

*#Support problems*

Most items have 10% cdr with a couple having 20%. Riot has made it so that unless you specifically avoid getting cdr you're probably going to get 10-20% out of your build. If you want to cap at 40% you need to either specifically aim for getting cdr items, or get runes.
I find myself CDR capped or close to it by accident often enough even without runes.

Zyra/Annie/Vel'Koz/Brand/Karma, and Morg.

Being a support mage with either, god scaling or high base damage, can often make you a prime juicy target I mean, you're basically the guy delegated to protecting someone else, you're poor, and you're squishy, and, contrary to popular belief, you can make a huge dent.

All we wanted was an ap item with only cdr. 

-not an ap item with cdr plus mana regen plus grievous wounds.
- not an ap it not an ap item with cdr plus mana regen plus magic resist. 
-not an ap item with cdr with a  stasis and armor.
-not an item with cdr with spell vamp

just an ap item with some cdr.  thats it
I think its pretty natural to put mana on a cdr item. If u r using spells more frequently you will tend to run out of mana faster.
Riot nerfed DFG ages ago for this exact reason, and now they're going back on it. It feels like they're just throwing shit at the wall to see what sticks.

But all of this is just states that his balance is based upon a static build path leaving counter-building, or smart purchases based on what the other people are building, mute.

Yay for diversity!

Not at all. If you're going against heavy magic damage, you can grab Abyssal for CDR. Against AD or knockbacks, you can grab Zhonya's. Even in most games you're going to want Zhonya's. You can always grab Protobelt or Ionian boots too against just about anything.

I wouldn't say he's static in the slightest - and I don't really remember me holding myself to a static build while testing him (had first items of Zhonya's, Rylai's, Protobelt and Abyssal in most of my games), so I wouldn't really say he's balanced around that.

Also, IMO, he's just straight up stronger. The reliability of the ult feels really, really good, at least for me. I always know what's going to get hit, and it's actually so cool watching you mow down multiple waves of minions as you dive into an enemy laner with your ult. Give him a shot =) I know I really enjoyed the changes, as someone who played a ton of Kennen the past couple seasons

> [{quoted}](name=Cezium,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xhhewdHM,comment-id=001900010000,timestamp=2016-05-05T00:11:18.136+0000)
>
> The reliability of the ult feels really, really good, at least for me. 

This is actually what I found to be lacking, with it hitting 3 enemies every .25 seconds it would stun alot faster. The issue here is normally you can't position to hit all 5 anyways. So this actually delays his stun from .75 seconds to 1.5 seconds. That is almost double the old time it took to stun a group of 1,2 or 3 targets.

Even if you hit an enemy every quarter second, you couldn't hit the same one again except for every half second. The fastest you could possibly stun someone with his old ultimate was after 1 second (assuming the first one goes off instantly, with 2 more over the next second, at 0.5 seconds and 1 second). The earliest a second enemy could be stunned was therefore at 1.25, a third at 2.5, a fourth at 2.75 and the last enemy after 4. With this new one? Every single enemy can be stunned after 1 second.

Your stun locking is actually pretty strong now =)

>Against AD or knockbacks, you can grab Zhonya's.

Given the state of Zhonya's right now it's an item which you should avoid buying wherever possible. It's statistically crap with an active on far too long of a CD to justify it. This probably isn't true on Kennen because of his ult, but on most mages it is. Zhonya's is just a bad item, I wouldn't look at it on somebody like Syndra in 90% of cases.

If your champion or situation in the game doesn't really need the active, then the item should be a bad buy. Did you think it was a good thing back when the item was a staple on everyone all the time?

I wish we could do similar things to ADC items... I know we went through an update already, but all it seemed to do was establish a new op or two, I'd like to see non-crit builds be more viable, and if it means an overall nerf to ADC items, so be it. they could probably use a nerf here or there anyway...

WEIRD numbers, yeah, because numbers can be weird you know. 
i mean of course they feel weird for rito's devs they don't see them much and dunno about maths.
6.25 isn't even a weird number, if they wanted weird they should have changed it to 3+pi.
Vel's ad growth tho
you wanna talk wierd numbers?  lets address vels attack damage per level...
It's not weird, it's beautiful.
Eye'm in agreement with you here.
It's intentional because 3.142 is the first three decimal places of Pi rounded off, so it's a play on the fact that Vel'Koz is a mathematical themed champion

the first decimal places of pi are 3.14159...  by rounding it up to 3.142 people wont get it, by keeping it at 3.14159... it gets confusing in a game where theres already spaghetti code, so having suge a huge undefined number as attack damage is wierd.

3.14159 isn't three decimal places, it's 5. And also having 3.14159 ... down ~15 digits isn't any different on the hardware side as 0.1 since 0.1 isn't possible in floating-point representation.

Additionally, code typically doesn't have to worry about those nitty-gritties of the exact numbers being used; even in C, you declare the thing a float or a double and go on with your day.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but isn't Zhonya's Hourglass a core item, maybe even the _first_ item, on AP Kennen? Because it now builds out of Fiendish Codex, which gives Kennen easy early access to 10% CDR. If he doesn't want that, Abyssal and the new Protobelt also grant 10% CDR. And _most champions_ have to actually buy _some_ CDR if they want to cross certain overlapping recast thresholds on their abilities.
it's likely intentional that they don't want the chain to be possible without CDR, since it is still possible with any increment of 10% CDR.

Are you seriously arguing about 0.25 seconds on an effect? You can't even react that fast so why are you complaining about it?

Especially when they gave Kennen's ult the GP treatment of affecting EVERYTHING inside of it for more consistency. If anything you should be grateful for the Ultimate update.

First, a quarter of a second is _well within_ normal human reaction time. Second, reaction isn't relevant, since the o/p was talking about spamming W as soon as it comes off cooldown, which doesn't require reaction anyway. What _is_ relevant is the increased availability of CDR, which makes rank 5 W still overlap with the innate passive.

Since so many items that are great on Kennen now give CDR, 
{{item:3157}} {{item:3001}} (Protobelt, no icon for that yet)
does that even matter all that much?

All 3 of those build out of a cheap item that gives 10% CDR, and by the time you have enough XP for a 6 second cooldown W, you damn well SHOULD have enough gold for either a {{item:3067}} or{{item:3108}}
Well Kennen rushes Zhonyas anyway which has CDR now so... does it really matter that much?
Well, at least you can still buy CDR. A lot easier to get now anyways.

And they removed charm's ability to stop dashes, the only way to win lane vs LB and Diana {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

That was one of the reasons I actually picked her up in the first place, she seemed unique in her playstyle
But I guess saying this to you of all people is pointless :P
Not to mention the fact that  interrupting dashes makes sense based on her lore, and that its was actually not easy to pull off.
